meanings.definition: Enzymes that break down disaccharides into monosaccharides.
meanings.sent1: The disaccharidases in your body help to turn complex sugars into simpler sugars.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how disaccharidases work to understand sugar digestion better.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharidases at the sugar party were the life of the event, breaking down all the double sugars!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to simplify complex ideas is like the disaccharidases breaking down disaccharides.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharidases acted like tiny sugar detectives, unraveling the mystery of double sugars.

meanings.definition: A type of enzyme that aids in the digestion of sugars.
meanings.sent1: When you eat, your body releases disaccharidases to help digest the sugars in your food.
meanings.sent2: Nutritionists often talk about the importance of disaccharidases in breaking down sugars for energy.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharidases in the stomach did a happy dance every time they successfully digested a sugar molecule.
meanings.sent4: Her love for baking is like the disaccharidases, always breaking down sugars to create delicious treats.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharidases worked tirelessly, like little sugar workers, to break down all the sweet molecules.

meanings.definition: Proteins that help in the breakdown of double sugars into simpler forms.
meanings.sent1: Your body produces disaccharidases to assist in converting double sugars into easier-to-absorb forms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are fascinated by the role of disaccharidases in simplifying complex sugar structures.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharidases were like sugar superheroes, swooping in to save the day by breaking down double sugars.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like disaccharidases, breaking down complicated problems into simpler solutions.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharidases functioned like tiny sugar transformers, changing double sugars into more manageable forms.
